titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that any resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict should come from direct bilateral negotiations without preconditions and without interference from the United Nations.

Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that any resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict should come from direct bilateral negotiations without preconditions and without interference from the United Nations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Middle East and North Africa.

committee.subcommittee: Middle East, North Africa and International Terrorism
committee.name: House Foreign Affairs

bill.summary: It is the sense of the House of Representatives that a resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict should come from direct bilateral negotiations without preconditions and without interference from the United Nations.
